text: [Music]
my name is eva mom Chava and I work at
the Space Telescope Science Institute
where I'm part of the data science
mission office my name is Ahmad Smith I
work at Space Telescope Science
Institute in Baltimore and I run the
data science mission office we are a
small team of scientists and engineers
that help support access to the archives
that we provide to the Islamic community
and also direct work on software
products and interfaces our archives and
missions that we support and so we serve
a worldwide community of astronomers who
want to use these telescopes in space
and we do everything from helping them
to plan observations through to
acquiring the data for them and
processing it returning it back to the
community from the data archives we host
a number of very high-value data sets
for yester non-community probably the
highest value data sets which we host is
the Hubble data which is 28 years of
observations with the Hubble Space
Telescope we want to share this data set
with with the world in this cloud
computing environment because we can
already see that the types of science
that people are going to have to do in
the future are going to require
significantly more computers typically
available to individual many academic
institutions and researchers don't
necessarily have access to very advanced
academic resource or so large amounts of
compute so using cloud computing allows
them to access such resources and do
research that wouldn't have been
possible to them
and as you expand that group of people
who have access to the computing
resources necessary to do interesting
and innovative research that definitely
always brings in new ideas and fresh
blood into the field and allows for new
types of science to be done so this is
us so making a step in the right
direction you think
[Music]
